TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ScriptResourceDefinition extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines the location of a script resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptResourceDefinition> object represents a single logical script resource. This resource might have several different physical representations, such as a debug version, a release version, and a version on a content delivery network (CDN).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the debug mode path of the script resource on a content delivery network (CDN).
Docs.value: The path of a CDN that contains debug script resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you reference a CDN path, you can enable CDN support for the page by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.EnableCdn%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> to `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the release mode path of a script resource on a content delivery network (CDN).

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you reference a CDN path, you can enable CDN support for the page by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.EnableCdn%2A> property of <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> to `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets or set a value that indicates to the whether a script resource should be accessed using a secure connection to the content delivery network (CDN) path when the page is accessed using HTTPS.
Docs.value: if the CDN should be accessed using HTTPS; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptResourceDefinition.CdnSupportsSecureConnection%2A> property to check whether the associated script resource should be accessed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> using a secure connection (SSL) to a CDN. By using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptResourceDefinition.CdnSupportsSecureConnection%2A> property, you can avoid a warning message from the browser when your Web application attempts to request secure content from a CDN that supports SSL.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the debug mode path of the script resource that is used when debug mode is enabled.
Docs.value: The path of a script resource that is used when debug mode is enabled.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a JavaScript expression that is used to detect whether a JavaScript file loaded successfully.
Docs.value: The JavaScript expression. The default is an empty string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.EnableCdnFallback%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to render inline script that will revert to loading the library from a local server location if the script fails to load from the CDN.
For script libraries from Microsoft, this value is already set. If you want to register a script yourself and get CDN fallback support, you would set this property to an expression. For example, to test whether a jQuery library has been loaded, you can use an expression like the following:
`typeof(window.jQuery) !== "undefined"`

Docs.summary: Gets or set the release mode path of the script resource.
Docs.value: The path of a script resource.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an assembly object that contains the script resource.
Docs.value: An assembly object that contains a script resource.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the script resource in the specified resource assembly.
Docs.value: The name of a script resource.
